skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Sequential subagent execution with two-stage review gates for implementation plans. Use when executing multi-task plans in current session, when tasks need fresh subagent context to avoid pollution, when formal review cycles (spec compliance then code quality) are required between tasks, or when you need diff-based validation of each task before proceeding.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and prompt templates. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file access capabilities exist. The skill provides workflow guidance for managing subagent development cycles.

content.user_title: Implement tasks with subagent review gates
content.value_statement: Complex multi-task implementations often suffer from scope creep, missed requirements, and quality issues. This skill provides a structured workflow with fresh subagents per task and dual-review gates (spec compliance then code quality) with diff-based validation to ensure every task is correctly implemented and properly reviewed before proceeding.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches fresh subagent for each implementation task
Tracks BASE_SHA and HEAD_SHA for diff-based review
Two-stage review gate: spec compliance then code quality
Verifies test results match implementer claims
Manages review cycles until approval is achieved
limitations: Requires git for SHA tracking and diff operations
Cannot execute tasks without a Task tool or equivalent
Depends on writing-plans skill for initial plan creation
Not designed for parallel implementers in same working tree

use_cases.title: Manage feature implementations
use_cases.description: Execute multi-task feature plans with structured reviews ensuring each task meets spec and quality standards.

use_cases.title: Validate diffs against specs
use_cases.description: Review implementation changes against original requirements using diff-based analysis for precise compliance checking.

use_cases.title: Control agent behavior
use_cases.description: Guide AI agents through structured implementation workflow with explicit checkpoints and scope boundaries.

prompt_templates.title: Implement task
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement Task N: [task name]. Use BASE_SHA: [sha]. Implement exactly what is specified, run tests, commit, and report HEAD_SHA with verification details.

prompt_templates.title: Spec compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review spec compliance for Task N. Use git diff BASE_SHA..HEAD_SHA to verify all requirements are met and no scope creep occurred.

prompt_templates.title: Code quality check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review code quality for Task N. Check error handling, edge cases, maintainability, test quality, and verify implementer test claims.

prompt_templates.title: Final integration review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform final review of entire implementation from initial BASE_SHA to final HEAD_SHA. Verify all requirements met and no cross-cutting issues.

output_examples.input: Execute this feature plan using subagent-driven development methodology.

best_practices: Always provide full task text to subagents rather than making them read plan files
Track BASE_SHA before each task and HEAD_SHA after each commit
Require implementers to confirm scope discipline before marking tasks complete
Use diff-based review exclusively instead of reviewing the entire repository
anti_patterns: Skipping either spec compliance or code quality review gates
Allowing implementers to touch unrelated files without explicit approval
Proceeding without verifying BASE_SHA and HEAD_SHA tracking
Accepting reports without required fields (SHA, commands, test output)

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support the Task tool required for dispatching subagents.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of tasks per plan?
faq.answer:: There is no hard limit. The methodology works for any number of tasks but shines with 3-10 task plans.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use writing-plans to create the initial plan, then this skill to execute it, and finishing-a-development-branch to complete.

faq.question: Is user data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only contains prompts for AI agents. No code execution, file access, or network operations occur.

faq.question: What if a subagent reports test failures?
faq.answer: The workflow requires tests to pass before proceeding. Failed tests trigger fix-dispatch cycles until all tests pass.

faq.question: How is this different from executing-plans?
faq.answer: executing-plans handles parallel sessions across branches. This skill handles sequential tasks in one branch with review gates.
